stc_methodology_traffic.xml

docs.text: Takes the load of a given mix and distributes it across the components of the mix, according to the JSON information found in the StmTemplateMix object for the traffic mix. Multiple StmTemplateMix objects can be processed by this command, but each will be processed independtly as though it were the only mix to be handled by this command. This command is typically called internally by the CreateTrafficMixCommand (when auto expand is enabled), or externally in the sequencer when changing of loads during iterative test loops is necessary.
docs.title: AllocateTrafficMixLoadCommand

docs.text: Extends spirent.methodology.CreateTemplateMixCommand.  This command creates mixtures of traffic between tagged end points. A traffic mix is a collection of groups of streamblocks. The traffic mix itself defines a total load that is spread across the mix (both the total load and the load units for the mix). Along with this common set of properties, the mix also has an array of components, where each component defines a group of one or more streamblocks. Each component has its own unique set of properties, including their portion of the mix's load, a set of end points, a streamblock template file, and an expansion method (e.g., route import (bgp only), route prefix distribution generation, or route specifications). Streamblocks within the mix can be bound or unbound. End points for bound streamblocks are always defined by tags, and can refer to any typical streamblock end point, such as port, route or interface. Streamblocks are created with a GeneratedObject relationship to their corresponding StmTemplateConfig objects, which are children of the StmTrafficMix object.
docs.title: CreateTrafficMixCommand

docs.text: Expands the traffic mix template(s) into streamblocks and attaches the streamblocks to end points designated in the traffic mix configuration. The traffic mix is defined from an StmTemplateMix object, populated with the mix information from the CreateTrafficMixCommand.

LoadAclTrafficRulesCommand


Extends spirent.methodology.traffic.LoadTrafficTemplateCommand.



Import an Access Control List traffic mix rules file and generate the stream blocks from the rules.


- Properties



RulesFileName (input:inputFilePath)
"Rules File Name"



File name and path to the rules file to import.




default: 
(empty)




StreamsPerRule (input:u32)
"Streams Per Rule"



The number of streams to create per rule.




default: 1




ConformToAccept (input:bool)
"Conform To Accept"



If true, the packet information is formed in conformity with the ACCEPT rules and non-conformity with the DENY rules,  thus the packets are expected to pass through the DUT. If false, then the packet information will conform with DENY and not with  ACCEPT, thus the packets are expected to be blocked by the DUT.




default: false




Weight (input:double)
"Load Weight (%)"



The fraction (percentage) of the total traffic mix load to be applied to the streamblock(s) generated by the given template. This value must be greater than 0 and not exceed 100. This value is added into the mix's weight list.




default: 10




- UsedIn





ACL Performance Test

AddRowToDbTableCommand


Add queried results to a new or existing table.


- Properties



SrcDatabase (input:u8)
"Source Database"



Select source database(s) to execute Sql query.




default: ALL_ITERATION
EnumSourceDatabase
    LAST_ITERATION = 0
    SUMMARY = 1
    ALL_ITERATION = 2







DstDatabase (input:u8)
"Destination Database"



Select destination database to create new table.




default: SUMMARY
EnumDestinationDatabase
    LAST_ITERATION = 0
    SUMMARY = 1







SqlCreateTable (input:string)
"Create Table Sql Statement"



Specify a table name for an existing destination table or a Create Table Sql statement for a new destination table. If the table exists, a new one shall not be created.




default: CREATE TABLE NewTableName ('Column1' INTEGER, 'Column2' TIMESTAMP)




SqlQuery (input:string)
"Source Data Sql Query"



Sql query for source data. Queried results shall be populated in new or existing table specified in Create Table Sql Statement field. The number of columns in the query must match the number of columns in the table.




default: SELECT Id, CreatedTime From DataSet




- UsedIn

BenchmarkStabilityIteratorCommand


Extends spirent.methodology.IteratorCommand.



Discrete step size binary or step search followed by stability test with backoff


- Properties



EnableStabilityBackoff (input:bool)
"Enable Stability Backoff"



Enable stability backoff iteration once a converged value is found.  If false, iteration will end once a converged value is found.




default: true




IterMode (input:u8)
"Iteration Mode"



Iteration mode




default: STEP
EnumIterMode
    STEP = 1
    BINARY = 2







StepVal (input:double)
"Step value"



Step value




default: 10




ValueType (input:u8)
"Value type"



Value type (list or range)




default: RANGE
EnumValueType
    RANGE = 1
    LIST = 2







ValueList (input:string)
"List of values"



List of values to test




default: 
(empty string)




RepeatCount (input:u32)
"Repeat Count"



Number of times to repeat an iteration




default: 5




SuccessPercent (input:double)
"Success Percent"



Number of times a repeated value has to pass to be considered stable




default: 100




CurrIndex (state:u32)
"Current Index"



Current list value's index




default: 0




IterState (state:u8)
"Iterator state"



Specifies what part of the search the iterator is in (goal-seeking or stability backoff)




default: SEARCH
EnumIterState
    SEARCH = 1
    STABILITY = 2







SearchIteration (state:u32)
"Goal-seeking Test Iteration Number"



Iteration number used during goal-seek testing




default: 0




SearchMinFail (state:double)
"Minimum fail value"



Minimum failing value encountered during search




default: 
(empty)




SearchMaxPass (state:double)
"Maximum pass value"



Maximum passing value encountered during search




default: 
(empty)




StabilityIteration (state:u32)
"Stability Test Iteration Number"



Iteration number used during stability testing




default: 0




StabilityTrialNum (state:u32)
"Stability Test Trial Number"



Trial number for a particular test value during stability testing




default: 0




StabilitySuccessCount (state:u32)
"Stability Success Count"



Number of successful trials in a iteration during stability testing




default: 0




IsConverged (output:bool)
"Is Converged"



Did the iterator converge?




default: false




ConvergedVal (output:string)
"Converged Value"



Value the iterator converged on




default: 
(empty string)




StableValue (output:string)
"Stable value"



Stable value




default: 0




FoundStableValue (output:bool)
"Found a stable value"



Flag indicating a stable value was found




default: false




BreakOnFail (input:bool)
"Break on fail"



Break out of the test when an iteration fails




default: false




MinVal (input:double)
"Minimum value"



Minimum value




default: 0




MaxVal (input:double)
"Maximum value"



Maximum value




default: 100




PrevIterVerdict (input:bool)
"Previous iteration result"



Result of the previous iteration




default: true




Iteration (state:u32)
"Iteration"



Iteration number




default: 0




CurrVal (state:string)
"Current value"



Value to use in the current iteration




default: 
(empty string)




ResetState (state:bool)
"Reset State"



Reset state properties




default: false




- UsedIn





Routing Multi-Protocol

                    "type": "number", 
                    "description": "Number that indicates how many device will be assigned per device block.  If 0, devicesPerBlock indicates all deviceCount is assigned to one block. If 1, devicesPerBlock = # of device blocks with a device count of 1. If devicesPerBlock > device count of component (after weight is applied), all devices go into one block.  Otherwise, blocks are greedily created until we run out of device count (ie. deviceCount = 17, devicesPerBlock = 5, blocks created with 5, 5, 5, 2 devices)."
                  }

       var caption = document.getElementById(id + '.h3link');

          e.style.display = 'none';
          caption.innerHTML = text.replace('[-]', '[+]');
       }
       else
       {
          e.style.display = 'block';
          caption.innerHTML = text.replace('[+]', '[-]');
       }
    }
